intro: Leucopogon tenuicaulis, commonly known as slender-stemmed heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to southern Australia, particularly found in regions with sandy soils and dry climates. The plant typically grows as a low, shrub-like form with narrow, wiry stems and small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands.
